pcanvas
Class Point

java.lang.Object
  pcanvas.Point

public class Point
extends java.lang.Object

Basic Point class. Contains three floats; x, y and z, which represent x, y and z coordinates (respectively) on some coordinate system.

interpolate

public Point interpolate(Point point,
                         float scale)
Standard linear interpolation of a Point. Uses this point instance as the base point, for interoplation, and the provided point object as the point to interpolate towards, using the provided scale.

Parameters:
point - the point to interpolate towards.
scale - the ratio of interpolation towards the provided point.
Returns:
this Point instance after it has been interpolated.

rotate

@Deprecated
public Point rotate(Point about,
                               float angle)
Deprecated. 

Rotates this point about another point by a given angle. This is actually a bit mis-guided. If you want a real 3D point rotate, please use GeomUtils.PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float).

Parameters:
about - which point to rotate this point about.
angle - the angle of rotation, in radians.
Returns:
this Point after it has been rotated to its destination.

rotateByDegrees

@Deprecated
public Point rotateByDegrees(Point about,
                                        float angle)
Deprecated. 

Same functionality as rotate(Point, float) except the accepted angle value must be in degrees. This is actually a bit mis-guided. If you want a real 3D point rotate, please use GeomUtils.PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float).

Parameters:
about - which point to rotate this point about.
angle - the angle of rotation, in degrees.
Returns:
this Point after it has been rotated to its destination.

                                Point other,

rotatePoint

@Deprecated
public static Point rotatePoint(Point point,
                                           Point about,
                                           float angle)
Deprecated. 

Performs a rotation of a point about another point by some angle of rotation (in radians).

This is actually a bit mis-guided. If you want a real 3D point rotate, please use GeomUtils.PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float).

Parameters:
point - the point to rotate.
about - the point to rotate about.
angle - the angle of rotation.
Returns:
a new Point which represents point rotated by angle around about.

rotatePointByDegrees

@Deprecated
public static Point rotatePointByDegrees(Point point,
                                                    Point about,
                                                    float angle)
Deprecated. 

Performs a rotation of a point about another point by some angle of rotation (in degrees).

This is actually a bit mis-guided. If you want a real 3D point rotate, please use GeomUtils.PointRotate3D(Point, Point, Vector, float).

Parameters:
point - the point to rotate.
about - the point to rotate about.
angle - the angle of rotation, in degrees.
Returns:
a new Point which represents point rotated by angle around about.

public static Point translatePoint(Point point,
                                   Vector translator)
Creates the representation of a point translated by a vector.

Parameters:
point - the point to translate.
translator - the Vector to translated our point by.
Returns:
a new Point instance which represents point translated by translator.

scaledTranslate

public static Point scaledTranslate(Point point,
                                    Vector translator,
                                    float scalar)
Creates the representation of a scaled translation of a point by a vector.

Parameters:
point - the point to translate.
translator - the Vector to translate by.
scalar - the scalar to scale the translator by before translating.
Returns:
a new Point instance which represents point translated by the scaled vector translator.

public static Point midPoint(Point point,
                             Point other)
Finds the mid-point (average) between two points.

Parameters:
point - first point.
other - second point.
Returns:
a mid-Point (or average point).

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
Checks for equality between this point and some object instance.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
o - the object to check equality against.
Returns:
true if the object reference is the same, and if the instance is a point and has the same x, y and z coordinates as this point. Else false.

clone

public Point clone()
Clones this point.

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
a new Point with this point's x, y and z coordinate values.

Returns a string representation of this point.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

the string "Point [x, y, z]."
